page.title: 08A wet Royal visit
page.content: 9.00a.m.24 May 1985 Crowds of people were walking up the old tracks to Maiden Castle. The reason? Simple, the Prince and Princess of Wales were arriving by helicopter at 10.00 a.m. Rain poured down, accompanied by gale force winds. We walked up the earth mound and stood crammed against a rope, tired and cold. Then we heard they weren't to come until 11.00 a.m. Television men were getting impatient. People waved everytime they thought the camera was on them. The helicopter was delayed by bad weather.By 11.30 a.m. we couldn't move our feet were stuck in the mud. The helicopter landed and the Royal couple came out. They shook about three hands and then headed into a tent. The crowd rushed forward,but no more was seen of the couple.
